title: Franck Ribery facing lengthy ban for shoving linesman after Fiorentina's Serie A loss against Lazio
text:
Franck Ribery could be set for a lengthy ban after taking his frustration out on the linesman following Fiorentina's defeat against Lazio in Serie A.

Fiorentina fell to a 2-1 reverse at home on Sunday night after Ciro Immobile scored a last-gasp winner for the visitors before Luca Ranieri was sent off for the hosts.

After Ribery set up Fiorentina's goal, he could only watch on from the sidelines having been subbed before Lazio struck the late controversial winner at the Artemio Franchi Stadium.

Franck Ribery forcefully shoved a linesman (right) following Fiorentina's narrow defeat

The Frenchman pushed the official not just once but twice following the final whistle

Moments before Immobile's decisive goal, Fiorentina were adamant they should have been given a free-kick for a foul but the referee waved play on and Ribery let his frustrations be known following the final whistle.

The Frenchman was filmed on camera in a heated conversation with the linesman. He could be seen shoving the linesman forcefully not just once, but twice, as he protested.

Serie A officials later confirmed that the 36-year-old was shown a red card following the match and is now facing what could be a long suspension.

Ribery kept protesting to the match official but was later shown a red card after the game

The 36-year-old had to be held back as his frustrations continued to boil over on Sunday night

Ribery featured for 75 minutes during the Serie A clash before being substituted

Serie A are keen to crack down on any mistreatment of match officials and could inflict a more severe punishment on Ribery, instead of just a three-match suspension.

The narrow defeat has left Fiorentina down in ninth place from nine games.

Vincenzo Montella's side take on Sassuolo next in Serie A on Wednesday night but will have to cope without the former Bayern Munich winger.
description: Fiorentina fell to a 2-1 defeat at home to Lazio on Sunday night after Ciro Immobile scored a last-gasp winner for the visitors before Luca Ranieri was sent off for the hosts.
